Key Match Events: Domantas Sabonis recorded 23 points and 28 rebounds.
Devin Carter led a 8-2 run in the fourth quarter with two three-pointers and a layup.
The Kings won the fourth quarter 38-21 to secure a 114-97 victory.
Pre-Game Insights: Doug Christie emphasized confidence in his players, instilling confidence in every player regardless of mistakes or good plays.
The Kings have now won 6 straight games and are back to.500 for the season.
The Kings are 3.5 games back from the 4th seed.
Post-Match Reflections: Keegan Murray talked about how Doug instills confidence in his players.
Coach Doug Christie highlighted the victory as a crucial step toward the championship.
James Ham has shifted to blaming Monte for everything, while Carter won't get his shot off and Ellis still has many flaws according to some fans.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings extended their win streak to 6 games.
The Kings gave Domas physical opportunities for offensive rebounds.
DeMar DeRozan and Malik Monk shared the ball while shooting through their slumps.
Others: The Kings played a close, hard-fought, entertaining game through three quarters.
The Kings went into Boston and won in a convincing fashion.
The Kings are playing free and almost reckless according to some fans.
